definitions.definition: (gerund) The act of persons or things that meet.
definitions.example: Meeting him will be exciting. I enjoy meeting new people.

definitions.definition: A gathering of persons for a purpose; an assembly.
definitions.example: We need to have a meeting about that soon.

definitions.definition: (collective) The people at such a gathering.
An encounter between people, even accidental.
definitions.example: They came together in a chance meeting on the way home from work.

definitions.definition: A place or instance of junction or intersection; a confluence.
definitions.example: Earthquakes occur at the meeting of tectonic plates.

definitions.definition: A religious service held by a charismatic preacher in small towns in the United States.
An administrative unit in the Religious Society of Friends (Quakers).
definitions.example: Denver meeting is a part of Intermountain yearly meeting.

definitions.definition: To make contact (with) while in proximity.
To make physical or perceptual contact.

definitions.example: This proposal meets my requirements. The company agrees to meet the cost of any repairs.

definitions.definition: To balance or come out correct.
To perceive; to come to a knowledge of; to have personal acquaintance with; to experience; to suffer.
definitions.example: The eye met a horrid sight. He met his fate.

definitions.definition: To be mixed with, to be combined with aspects of.
